First, we need to know who King Arthur is - he was a legendary British leader who, according to medieval histories and romances, led the defence of Britain against Saxon invaders in the late 5th and early 6th centuries AD. 

Next, we need to consider whether swallows are relevant to King Arthur or the legend surrounding him. Indeed, there is a famous legend from Arthurian mythology regarding the Sword in the Stone. This myth describes how young King Arthur was able to pull a sword from a stone, thereby proving himself as the one true king of England. In some versions of the story, a swallow is said to have perched on the sword as he pulled it out, thus marking him as the chosen one. 

Finally, we need to determine if this legend has been depicted in a film. The most famous film adaptation of the King Arthur legend is likely "Excalibur" (1981) directed by John Boorman. In this film, the role of the swallow is indeed portrayed - as Arthur pulls the sword from the stone, a swallow appears and lands on the hilt of the sword, solidifying his fate as the rightful king. Therefore, answer (A) - "yes" - is correct.
